intro: Sida tenuicaulis, commonly known as slenderleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and linear, slender leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils. Sida tenuicaulis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a low-growing, sprawling habit.
